MS MCQs

    Build a web API with Node.js and Express

    »

    1. What steps must you go through in constructing a Web application with Express?

      Instantiate an app, configure routes, set up middleware, set up error handlers, listen to the server

      Instantiate an app, listen to the server

      Instantiate an app, configure routes, listen to the server

      Instantiate an app, configure routes, set up middleware, listen to the server


    2. What is the preferred way to send a JSON response from an Express app?

      Call the json() helper method on the response object like so: res.json({ content: ‘’ })

      Call res.send({ content: ‘’ })

      Call res.send(JSON.stringify({ content: ‘’ }))

      Use any of these ways: res.type(‘json’), res.type(‘application/json’), res.contentType(‘application/json’), res.format({ ‘application/json’: function() { res.send({}) } })


    3. How would set up Express to handle a post request with JSON data?

      Call app.use(bodyParser.json()) at the top, register a route by using the post method as in app.post(, () =>{}), read from req.body

      Register a route by using the post method as in app.post(, () =>{}), read from req.body

      Configure body parsing middleware, register a route by using the post method as in app.post(, () =>{}), read from req.data

      Call app.use(bodyParser.urlencoded({ extended: false })) at the top, register a route by using the post method as in app.post(, () =>{}), read from req.body
